items.title: Lexar’s 4TB aluminum portable SSD with built-in carabiner loop is nearly 50% off today at $210
items.summary:
As part of its daily Deal Zone offers, B&H is offering Lexar’s 4TB SL600 portable SSD for $209.99 shipped with a $50 coupon that auto-applies during checkout. This model usually sells for $350 and rarely sees discounts. B&H, however, is offering a solid 40% discount on it today, shaving $140 off and bringing it down to the lowest price we can find. It’s still listed at full price at other retailers, so now’s a good time to grab it while the deal lasts if you’ve been eyeing this drive. This portable drive has a unique design with a built-in carabiner loop, similar to Samsung’s T5 EVO model, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

more…

items.title: After Trump and Xi's meeting, China says it will suspend its rare earth export controls issued on October 9 for one year, but says nothing about earlier limits (Keith Bradsher/New York Times)
items.summary:
Keith Bradsher / New York Times:
After Trump and Xi's meeting, China says it will suspend its rare earth export controls issued on October 9 for one year, but says nothing about earlier limits  —  China has suspended export controls announced this month, but was conspicuously silent about rules imposed earlier, which are snarling global supply chains.

items.summary:

This updated sale event includes a bunch of fresh Logitech gear that previously weren’t included earlier, like the MX Master 3S and the MX MX Keys S Combo, and the prices for items here start at just $9. Most of these units are brand new, but you’ll also find open-box steals delivering deeper discounts like this offer on the brand’s MX Keys S Wireless Keyboard that drops it down to $89.99 Prime shipped. What makes this sale even better is that you can use code LOGITECHFIVE at checkout for an extra $5 off for a limited time. Head below for more details.

Update: The new Resident Evil Requiem Switch 2 Pro Controller is now up for pre-order at Best Buy. 

As soon as we get through the year, Resident Evil Requiem will quickly become the most anticipated thing in gaming, if it isn’t already, and no matter what platform you want to play it on. Alongside pre-order listings for the new RE9 going live across console and PC, a brand Resident Evil Requiem Nintendo Switch 2 Pro controller has been revealed alongside the announcement of upcoming amiibo and details on the deluxe edition and pre-order bonuses. Pre-orders for all platforms are starting to appear on Amazon and over at Best Buy.
